result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jesse R. Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2) Notify PCDA of any change of residence or employment.
3) One month prior to completion of agrmt. contact PCDA for final interview.
4) Report in person as request by PCDA or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

supervisions.notes:
Serve 30 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 04-11-2014 at 6:00 p.m.  May serve in winnebago County if at no cost to Pepin County and is traditional jail, no electronic monitoring.  Huber privileges granted for work only.
Consecutive to: Count 2 in 14CM08

records.addlTxt:
Now comes Jon D. Seifert, District Atty in and for Pepin Co., on behalf of the S/W and moves the Court for an Order to Dismiss without prejudice to either party.  
The basis for the Motion is that the Defendant has complied with the terms of his Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement.
ORDER:  Motion is granted and 2014CF02 Count 1 is hereby dismissed w/o prejudice to either party.

Defendant Jesse R. Bauer in court with attorney Haley Breese Wright.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of elements/max. penalties in Count 1 & Count 2 in 14CF02 and Count 2 in 14CM08.  Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Subject to DPA in Count 1 of 14CF02, Defendant pleads guilty.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2 in 14CF02 & Count 2 in 14CM08.  PLQ/WRF filed & reviewed.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas in Count 2 of 14CF02 & Count 2 of 14CM08, finds defendant guilty.  Approves DPA in Count 1 of 14CF02.  14CF02 sentenced to 30 days in the Pepin County Jail.  14CM08 sentenced to 30 days PCJ consecutive to 14CF02.  Appeal rights given.
Waiver form filed with the Court & done on the record.

Defendant Jesse R. Bauer in court with attorney Haley Breese Wright.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of resolution in 14CF02 & 14CM08.  Defendant waives right to P.H. done knowingly & voluntarily.  Court accepts Information for filing.
